jurls.reinforcementlearning.domains.arcade.rl

Class SarsaLearner

  • java.lang.Object
    • jurls.reinforcementlearning.domains.arcade.rl.SarsaLearner

  • public class SarsaLearner
extends java.lang.Object
    A class that acts accordingly to an epsilon-greedy policy and learns using SARSA(lambda).
    Author:
    Marc G. Bellemare

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected int action 
      protected double alpha
      Learning rate
      protected double epsilon
      Probability of a random action
      protected double[] features 
      protected double gamma
      Discount factor
      protected double lambda
      Eligibility trace parameter
      protected int lastAction
      A set of variables used to perform the SARSA update
      protected double[] lastFeatures 
      static double minTrace
      The threshold below which we consider traces to be 0
      protected int numActions
      The number of actions considered by the learner
      protected double[][] traces
      Eligibility traces; need separate traces for each action
      protected LinearModel[] valueFunction
      Q-value models, one per action

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SarsaLearner(int numFeatures, int numActions)
      Creates a new SarsaLearner that expects a feature vector of size 'numFeatures' and takes one of 'numActions' actions.

      Take an action and learn from the option given the current state and current observation.

      • updateTraces

        public void updateTraces(double[] features,
                         int lastAction)
        Updates the eligibility traces for all actions. The action that was actually taken has the current feature vector added to its traces; all others are simply decayed.
        Parameters:
        features -
        lastAction -

        protected final void createModels(int numActions,
                                  int numFeatures)
        This method constructs the set of models used by this agent.
        Parameters:
